stimulusHtml: Use a right Riemann sum with the four subintervals indicated by the data in the table to approximate  ∫ 0 12 k ( t )dt MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4048@ . Indicate units of measure. Is this approximation an overestimate or an underestimate for the value of ∫ 0 12 k ( t )dt MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4048@ ? Explain your reasoning.

features.html:
t (seconds)

 0 3 5 8 12

k(t) (feet per second)

 0 5 10 20 24

Kathleen skates on a straight track. She starts from rest at the starting line at time t = 0. For 0 < t ≤ 12 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3BF7@ seconds, Kathleen’s velocity k, measured in feet per second, is differentiable and increasing. Values of k(t) at various times t are given in the table above.
